comments:
While trying to upgrade Eclipse recently to 2.1.2, I got the following error on
the first run (in workspace/.metadata/.log on Win32):

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Nov 12, 2003 13:52:27.709
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformMetaAreaLock.acquire(PlatformMetaAreaLock.java:26)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.createLockFile(InternalPlatform.java:219)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderStartup(InternalPlatform.java:677)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:1049)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:838)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)

The line in question in PlatformMetaAreaLock is
  fileStream = new FileOutputStream(lockFile,true);

FileOutputStream does not have a (File, boolean) constructor in jdk 1.3, but it
does in 1.4. Up until 2.1.2, Eclipse 2.1 was runnable with a 1.3 jdk. I think
that the silent version requirement jump can be considered a bug.

Thanks,
Dave Neary.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 44814 ***

Are you sure that you upgraded to 2.1.2 and not one of the 3.0 builds?

The PlatformMetaAreaLock class was not created until October and was not
included in the 2.1.2 build.

Verifying... deleting the entire eclipse subdirectory, and unzipping eclipse-
SDK-2.1.2-win32.zip 

I had tried installing 3.0 first, but then fell back to 2.1.x when I saw that 
you needed a jdk 1.4.

Well whaddaya know... Eclipse 2.1.2 up & running. Perhaps I unzipped the old 
eclipse on top of the new one, or some such skullduggery.

Thanks for the help :)
Dave.
